intro: Heteropolygonatum urceolatum, commonly known as the spoonleaf clubmoss, is a species of primitive vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spoon-shaped leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stem. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its sporophyte develops into a short, erect stem with spirally arranged leaves. Heteropolygonatum urceolatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
